definition: soul/mortal soul, i.e. attached to the body

sentences.english: Also he should be physically strong and mentally sound.
sentences.chinese: 同時他應該有強健的體魄和良好的精神狀態。

sentences.english: Mr. Dolittle attributes his good health to careful living.
sentences.chinese: 杜立德先生把自己健壯的體魄歸功於審慎的生活方式。

sentences.english: Leo'shealth habits : Leos have robust constitutions, supple spines, and good coordination.
sentences.chinese: 獅子座人有着健壯的體魄，極強的柔韌度和協調性。

sentences.english: Your patience and effort will pay off in a lifetime of better health.
sentences.chinese: 你的恆心和努力會爲你贏得一生的健康體魄。

sentences.english: He once had a beefy body that others begrudged .
sentences.chinese: 他曾經擁有健壯的讓別人妒忌的體魄。

sentences.english: Traditional Chinese medicine says that good health is associated with the balance of qi -- an energy force that flows through the body.
sentences.chinese: 中國傳統醫學認爲，健康的體魄與氣脈平衡有關。

sentences.english: We can't definitively say there's a cause-and-effect relationship between sex and better health.
sentences.chinese: 我們無法確切地說性生活與健康體魄之間有因果關係。

definition: to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to bear hardships and work hard (idiom); assiduous and long-suffering/hard-working and capable of overcoming adversity
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
